poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Starknet CU Budget Extension (SNE-001) (MIP14c2-SP4) - March 13, 2023

content.content: MIP14c2-SP4: Starknet CU Budget Extension (SNE-001)  Preamble MIP14c2-SP#: 4 Author(s): @pyramidmaker Contributors:  Tags: Starknet Status: Formal Submission Date Proposed: 2023-01-12 Date ratified:  Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip14c2-sp4-starknet-cu-budget-extension/19403/1 Ratification Poll URL: TBD --- Amount: 123,000 DAI   Specification  Sentence Reason SNE-001 has delivered on its phase II milestones on budget:   Fast withdrawals: Contracts are deployed on mainnet. The front-end will be deployed within 2 weeks. We are waiting for Starkware to finalize the integration to Starkgate, their bridge interface  Teleport: First versions of Starknet contracts necessary for teleport have been developed  See Layer 2 Roadmap - History and future for a broader context on teleport planning with PE-001. SNE-001 has also developed a first version of the Starknet contracts necessary for dss-bridge. SNE-001 will propose in June a joint end-game strategy with PE-001. This proposal will include an ecosystem positioning as well as an additional budget to finish teleport and the contracts required for full MCD on Starknet. SNE-001 had funding until July 2022. However, given that the dss-teleport and dss-bridge development has taken more time than initially envisioned due to technical complexities on PECU on Starknet sides, we have decided to reduce costs to deliver the same promised deliverables within the same budget. We currently have enough funds in our CU wallet until the end of March. We are requesting a budget extension until June of 123,000 DAI.  Reason details We will be in a position to ask for additional budget in June.   The current balance held in the CU wallet is: 157,000 DAI (January salaries have already been paid)   Our typical monthly burn is: 35,000   The forecasted spend until June is: 280,000  Salaries: 35,000 * 5 = 175,000 DAI Audit: 50,000 DAI Conferences & offsite: 15,000 DAI Formal verification: 40,000 DAI    The gap to be financed is 280,000 - 157,000 = 123,000 DAI    Surplus Analysis Proposed transfer can be taken from the current Surplus Buffer.  Targets Recipient is SNE-001 CU Multi-sig Wallet. Recipient Address: 0x6D348f18c88D45243705D4fdEeB6538c6a9191F1``` Amount To Transfer: 123,000 DAI
content.GPT-summary: The post is a formal submission of a budget extension proposal for the Starknet CU project. The author explains the progress made so far and the reasons for the budget extension request. The post also includes a surplus analysis and targets for the proposed transfer. A 3rd party could give entirely positive feedback on the proposal, constructive criticism, or ask questions about it.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This is a summary of the contents of this subproposal and its impact, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This is a valid subproposal to request a DAI transfer from the Maker Protocol, as defined in MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer. SNE-001 had an approved budget until July 2022. However, they currently have enough unused funds to cover expenses until March 2023. SNE-001 is requesting a budget extension of 123,000 DAI until June 2023. This proposal has been assigned High-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2023-02-28
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: The protocol DAI transfer ceiling having been lifted (link to vote), we have adjusted our request to fit our needs originally stated (DAI 83k). We also added a budget for formal verification as teams working on this are stuck or giving up due to lack of financial support (DAI 40k). Hence bringing our total request to DAI 123k.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: It is our intent to submit formally this MIP for the March governance cycle @Gala
